question: Which university does David Lewis play basketball for?

**Breaking News: David Lewis Takes the Court in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball**

In a thrilling development, college basketball enthusiasts are abuzz with the news that David Lewis, a talented player from Texas Christian University, has joined the esteemed ranks of the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. According to credible sources, Lewis suited up for the Horned Frogs during the 1992 season, solidifying his position as a formidable force in the competitive world of college hoops. "We're thrilled to have David Lewis on our team," said TCU Head Coach, Moe Iba, in an exclusive interview. "He brings a level of athleticism and dedication that will undoubtedly elevate our game." Data from the NCAA confirms Lewis's participation in the Division I men's basketball league. According to the organization's official records, Lewis was a member of the TCU Horned Frogs men's basketball team during the 1992 season, competing against top-tier opponents in the Southwest Conference. "David Lewis is an exceptional player with a strong work ethic," said Dr. Rick Hart, TCU's Athletic Director. "We're proud to have him represent our university in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league." The NCAA Division I men's basketball league is the highest level of college basketball in the United States, featuring 358 teams from across the country. To be eligible to compete at this level, student-athletes must meet rigorous academic and athletic standards, making Lewis's achievement all the more impressive. With Lewis on the court, TCU fans can expect an exciting season filled with nail-biting matchups and electrifying performances. As the Horned Frogs take on the best of the best in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league, one thing is clear: David Lewis is ready to make his mark. **Statistics:**

* David Lewis played for TCU during the 1992 season. * The NCAA Division I men's basketball league features 358 teams from across the United States. * TCU is a member of the Southwest Conference, one of the most competitive athletic conferences in the country.

**SHOCKER IN COLLEGE HOOPS: TCU'S DAVID LEWIS MAKES HISTORY IN NCAA DIVISION I WOMEN'S BASKETBALL**

Fort Worth, TX - In a stunning turn of events, Texas Christian University's (TCU) David Lewis has become the first male player to compete in the NCAA Division I women's basketball league. The 6'5" forward, who played for the Horned Frogs men's team in the 1991-1992 season, has made headlines by joining the TCU women's basketball team for the current season. Lewis, a junior from Dallas, Texas, made his debut for the Lady Frogs on Saturday, scoring 12 points and grabbing 7 rebounds in a 75-62 win over the University of Houston. When asked about his decision to switch teams, Lewis said, "I've always respected the women's game and the level of competition. I wanted to challenge myself and see if I could make a difference on the court." TCU women's basketball head coach, Karen Aston, praised Lewis's skills and work ethic, saying, "David has been a great addition to our team. He brings a unique perspective and skillset that has already made an impact on our game plan." According to NCAA officials, Lewis's eligibility was cleared after a thorough review of his transfer request. "We've never had a situation like this before, but we're committed to providing opportunities for all student-athletes," said NCAA spokesperson, Emily James. Lewis's teammates have welcomed him with open arms, with senior guard, Kiara Jackson, stating, "David's been a great teammate from day one. He's fit in seamlessly and has already become a leader on our team." As the Lady Frogs prepare for their next game against Baylor University, Lewis's presence is expected to draw large crowds and generate buzz around the league. When asked about the attention, Lewis humbly replied, "I'm just focused on helping my team win. If my presence can bring more fans to the games, that's a bonus." The NCAA has reported a significant increase in ticket sales for women's basketball games since Lewis's debut, with Saturday's game against Houston drawing a record crowd of 4,500 fans. As the season unfolds, all eyes will be on Lewis and the Lady Frogs to see if they can make a deep run in the NCAA tournament.
